did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: M. E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University at Albany, SUNY

did.abstract: George Wise Papers document history about General Electric founded in Schenectady, New York
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this manuscript group were donated to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, by George Wise prior to March 1993.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: George Wise was a former General Electric (GE) employee and historian of Thomas Edison, Willis R. Whitney, GE, and the US Industrial Research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: General Electric's Century: A History of General Electric from its Origins to 1986 is an unpublished manuscript. The manuscript will be helpful to researchers seeking background information about General Electric, which was founded in Schenectady, New York. The manuscript's chapter titles include: "The Old General Electric and the New GE;" "Edison and General Electric;" "Shoemakers;" "Schenectady, Strikes and Socialists;" "Virtous Cycles;" "Progressivism to Prgoress;" "How the Robots Didn't Devour Schenectady;" "Plastic Edicson;" and "Second Century."

Additional information about General Electric can be found in related collections in the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives including the records of Helen Quirini (APAP102), IUE Local 301 (APAP023), and Associated Industries of New York State, Inc.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, George Wise Papers, circa 1989. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as [shortened name]).
